channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why investing in women’s health is good for business
item.description: Dr. Anita Zaidi is president of the Gender Equality Division at the Gates Foundation.

item.title: Lower gas prices could follow from OPEC+ boosting production by 547,000 barrels per day
item.description: Brent crude oil has been trading near $70 per barrel, which could be due to a potential loss of Russian oil on the market and a large rise in crude in...

item.title: What’s It Like to Deal With Brutal U.S. Tariffs? Ask Malaysia.
item.description: Once a cog in the Malaysian economy, the solar industry profited from Chinese investment. Now it’s becoming a case study of what happens when the Unit...

item.title: Trump’s Immigrant Crackdown in New York: More Arrests, Longer Detention
item.description: More than half of the immigrants arrested in the New York City area since Jan. 20 do not have criminal convictions or charges, new data shows.

item.title: Tesla Grants Musk $29 Billion in Stock to ‘Keep Elon’s Energies Focused’
item.description: The “interim” package announced on Monday was intended to help retain Elon Musk, whose previous pay plan was invalidated by a judge.

item.title: What to know about Erika McEntarfer, the BLS commissioner fired by Trump
item.description: She joins a growing list of people fired by Trump since January.

item.title: For the first time ever, all major casinos on the Las Vegas strip are unionized
item.description: “It’s always been our goal to make sure that this town is a union town," said Ted Pappageorge, lead negotiator of the Culinary Workers Union.

item.title: More than 140 African Migrants Feared Dead In Boat Disaster Near Yemen
item.description: The vessel capsized along a heavily traveled but treacherous route for Africans transiting the war-torn country to find work in the rich Gulf states.

item.title: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei says his employees are refusing Zuckerberg’s $100 million payout—and he’s not even matching salaries to keep them
item.description: Anthropic’s billionaire boss Dario Amodei isn’t willing to fight fire with fire by raising his own staffers’ salaries to convince them to stay—yet ret...

item.title: You Are Contaminated
item.description: The toxic byproducts of human civilization are everywhere. Even in our bodies.

item.title: More than 140 African Migrants Feared Dead In Boat Disaster Near Yemen
item.description: The vessel capsized along a heavily traveled but treacherous route for Africans transiting the war-torn country to find work in the rich Gulf states.

item.title: From Triumph in Iran to Starvation in Gaza: Netanyahu Squanders His Moment to Halt the War
item.description: Six weeks after Benjamin Netanyahu scored a victory over Iran, the Israeli leader is now pushing for an “all or nothing” deal with Hamas. But he has n...

item.title: El Salvador’s Leader Is Autocrat to Some, Godsend to Others
item.description: Lawmakers approved constitutional changes abolishing term limits and allowing President Nayib Bukele to stay in power indefinitely. Why now?
